stories.text:
Mild hearing loss in one ear will require me to wear a hearing aid (BTE or RITE) on one side. I enjoy listening to podcasts and music but also need to be on a fair number of calls for work throughout the week. I don't have high requirements regarding sound quality as long as the music sounds good enough, I do like a bit of base if possible.

Until now I used in-ear headphones for music and an on-ear headset for work. Upon a bit of searching the web, I couldn't find an obvious alternative that works well with a hearing aid, over-ear and on-ear seem to cause feedback and in-ear simply won't be possible anymore. At least that's what I found.

Does anyone have experience with this and can recommend a setup? Thank you.
stories.title: Ask HN: Hearing aid and listening to music / making calls

stories.text:
I'm an american working at a company in the EU and not sure the extent to which diversity is something they think about.

No judgement on whether diversity is in of itself good or bad, just wondering whether its something that people think about culturally
stories.title: Ask HN: Is the push for diversity in tech just an American thing?
